moves.3. e4: grab centre control.. I can regain the pawn at will (theoretically)
moves.4. a3: I don't want a pawn rush this early
moves.4... Bb7: challenging my control of the center
moves.5... e6: opening a lane for his black bishop
moves.7. Nxb5: abandoning my e4 pawn, but I can gain a pawn on the exchange
moves.9. Nxd6+: don't know why I did that, just didn't like the bishop
moves.9... Qxd6: I think I would have taken it with the pawn
moves.10. O-O: put the king in a safe place
moves.12... O-O: I would have played Qxd4, but he castles
moves.13. Nxd7: I don't like knights (particularly in pairs)
moves.13... Nxd7 14. Qd1: I finally notice my pawn is naked
moves.15... Bb7: so does he (I have no idea why)
moves.16... g5: a weak move, in my opinion
moves.17. Re1: I threaten to total expose the kings clothing
moves.18... Qc6: mate in one if I leave the g-file unprotected
moves.19. Bxg5: continuing with my plan, but keeping a close eye on g2 protection
moves.19... hxg5: the plan is going as forseen
moves.20. Qh5+: I can temporarily abandon g2 protection
moves.20... Kg7: I guess Kg8 was wishful thinking
moves.21. Qxg5+: force him back and protect g2
moves.26. Rh5+: discovered check forces him back to the g-file
